Gets the current derivative in the iteration

boost::intrusive_ptr< Derivative > DerivativeIterator::findCombination ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Derivative >  comp_deriv,
boost::intrusive_ptr< Derivative >  value_deriv 
)

Find a combination derivative. We have three different derivative iterators. The main iterator iterates through all the final values that will be computed. The compute iterator is the iterator for computed derivatives. The value iterator iterates through the provided values. In other words, suppose you wish to compute 3rd derivatives by displaced gradients. The main iterator iterates all 3rd derivatives, the compute iterator iterates all 2nd derivatives, and the value iterator iterates all first derivatives. Given a compute derivative and a value derivative, this method returns the combined derivative in the main iterator. For example, the computed derivative might be <1,0,1> and the value derivative might be <1,0,0> so the combination derivative would be <2,0,1>

Parameters:
comp_deriv The computed derivative
value_deriv The value that was differentiated
Returns:
The mixed derivative

bool DerivativeIterator::finished (  )

If the iteration is finished

void gigide::DerivativeIterator::generateDerivativeCombos ( int  level,
std::vector< std::vector< int > > &  combos 
) [private]

Generates all possible unique derivative combinations. These are generated in the level representation. See Derivative::levels_ for the vector format.

Parameters:
level The level of derivative to generate (i.e. 1st, 2nd, etc...)
combos The vector to place the final results in

int DerivativeIterator::nderivs ( int  low = -1,
int  high = -1,
int  nonzero_level = -1 
)

Gets the number of derivatives based on given iteration criteria

Parameters:
low The lowest level of derivative to include, i.e. if 2, only 2nd and higher derivatives will be included.
high The highest level of derivative to include, i.e. if 2, only 2nd and lower derivatives will be included.
nonzero_level Unless specified otherwise, rigorously zero derivatives are included. If a value is given, then certain zero derivatives will be skipped. For example, if 2 is given, then all 3rd and higher zero derivatives are skipped. If -1 is given, all zero derivatives are included. If 0 is given, all zero derivatives will be skipped.
Returns:
The number of derivatives that will be iterated for the given criteria

void DerivativeIterator::next (  ) 

Sends the iterator to the next derivative

bool DerivativeIterator::nextPointIsValid (  )  [private]

Based on the criteria specified in starting the iteration, check whether the next point should be included in the iteration. See DerivativeIterator::start.

Returns:
Whether the point meets the iteration criteria

void gigide::DerivativeIterator::recurseDerivativeCombos ( int  level,
int  quanta,
int  start_index,
std::vector< std::vector< int > > &  all_combos,
std::vector< int >  current_combo 
) [private]

Derivatives are generated by recursion.

Parameters:
level The level of derivative combinations being generated, i.e. (1,2,3...)
quanta The number of derivative quanta that have so far been used in the recursion. For example, the vector <1,1,0,0> has quanta 2, <1,0,2,0> has quanta 3 and so forth.
start_index The coordinate number to start distributing quanta on
all_combos The set of all derivative combinations
current_combo The current derivative being built in the recursion. This should copy so that the reference is reset. This vector needs to be independent.

The molecule the derivatives are based on

int gigide::DerivativeIterator::nonzero_level_ [private]

When iterating, zero derivatives may or may not be included and this may vary depending on the level For example, you may wish to include zero 2nd derivatives, but only non-zero 3rd derivatives. In the iteration, all derivatives that are zero and of degree higher than nonzero level will not be included

int gigide::DerivativeIterator::num_coordinates_ [private]

The number of coordinates
